channel.title: My Updater
channel.description:
This is a rather incomplete updater; Feel free to jack whatever you want from it I honestly don't care. I feel I'm not doing my duty to both patch and finish up this project and that the community has a better chance of doing so; It's important to note that I've removed [i]most[/i] secondary splines because if I ever do decide to return to my updater, I'd like to have some splines that aren't broke as hell. Notice that menu's aren't completely done, it's simple to finish up menu's I just don't seem to have the time or care to do so.
This also has something like 4 testing jar's included with it, for you to add splines and work with them; Also, this updater design is rather old, but still uses my "context" approach instead of match approach; Yes matching can be faster, but context's are much much more "secure" if you may.
In conclusion, my intention with the BCEL bot was of course and ALWAYS to release it publicly when complete, but seeing as how I'm not making progress and really not giving it all that much effort I feel it's best if I release AS IS. So, this code is "AS IS" and I doubt I will do further work on this particular updater and I deserve all the 'flamage' in the world for such sloppy coding, but seeing as I'm the only one releasing anything, you best not... I release this code with absolutely no liability for lost accounts or legal ramifications hereon. I do not really much play this game, nor do I "care" to play this game in the future.
Beyond what I have, there's not much "real" work left, except to hook camera x, y, z; Once that's done, an auto updating "autofighter" is easily conceivable. Also feel free to cut bits of code and add to existing "updaters" you may or may not have, such as the semi-complete exp updater that identifies 2 of said arrays perfectly; or the chat message splines that identify all 3 perfectly. The chat state flags were identified haphazardly so forgive me but those wont necessarily update perfectly.
Now the only thing I ask of the community, is give credit. I don't care if you're a moron like sythe or his moderators and take my code, but just because you refactor it or add 1 to 2 lines DOES NOT MEAN IT'S YOUR CODE; You seem to have a minuscule understanding of "plagiarism", maybe it's because you're foreign morons; either way the definition is so here so read: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plagiarism; If you fix someones code, it does NOT mean it's your work, it just means you applied a patch jackasses. It's still my work, all you need add is "fix/patch by blahhh"; Learn plagiarism, or you fail at life.
Anyway, beyond that, I don't much care or want money for this (though ruler has begged me to charge). I don't feel that charging for something that violates a TOS anyway is much of an intelligent thing to do. Nor do I feel sythe/ruler/guy who made sbot, deserve compensation for having the intelligence to actually rip/and/or make cheats for a childs' game; even if it is heavily obbed.
I'm not however quitting the rs2 cheating community, I'm simply becoming more inactive with it; I hope one day I may have the time/care/effort to start once again.
So with that, enjoy.
edit: Affix || Cruelintentionz.net || wTalk.org MUSIC MOD says: got a bot I can use it with ;) pplsuqbawlz says: it works just write a loader and what not or take mine pplsuqbawlz says: and apply ollie's patch kay?
[edit] Might I get a sticky mates? [/edit]

item.title: My Updater
item.dc:creator: @ack ack
item.description:
@ack wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:1, topic:68821”]This is a rather incomplete updater; Feel free to jack whatever you want from it I honestly don’t care. I feel I’m not doing my duty to both patch and finish up this project and that the community has a better chance of doing so; It’s important to note that I’ve removed most secondary splines because if I ever do decide to return to my updater, I’d like to have some splines that aren’t broke as hell. Notice that menu’s aren’t completely done, it’s simple to finish up menu’s I just don’t seem to have the time or care to do so.

This also has something like 4 testing jar’s included with it, for you to add splines and work with them; Also, this updater design is rather old, but still uses my “context” approach instead of match approach; Yes matching can be faster, but context’s are much much more “secure” if you may.

In conclusion, my intention with the BCEL bot was of course and ALWAYS to release it publicly when complete, but seeing as how I’m not making progress and really not giving it all that much effort I feel it’s best if I release AS IS. So, this code is “AS IS” and I doubt I will do further work on this particular updater and I deserve all the ‘flamage’ in the world for such sloppy coding, but seeing as I’m the only one releasing anything, you best not… I release this code with absolutely no liability for lost accounts or legal ramifications hereon. I do not really much play this game, nor do I “care” to play this game in the future.

Beyond what I have, there’s not much “real” work left, except to hook camera x, y, z; Once that’s done, an auto updating “autofighter” is easily conceivable. Also feel free to cut bits of code and add to existing “updaters” you may or may not have, such as the semi-complete exp updater that identifies 2 of said arrays perfectly; or the chat message splines that identify all 3 perfectly. The chat state flags were identified haphazardly so forgive me but those wont necessarily update perfectly.

Now the only thing I ask of the community, is give credit. I don’t care if you’re a moron like sythe or his moderators and take my code, but just because you refactor it or add 1 to 2 lines DOES NOT MEAN IT’S YOUR CODE; You seem to have a minuscule understanding of “plagiarism”, maybe it’s because you’re foreign morons; either way the definition is so here so read: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plagiarism; If you fix someones code, it does NOT mean it’s your work, it just means you applied a patch jackasses. It’s still my work, all you need add is “fix/patch by blahhh”; Learn plagiarism, or you fail at life.

Anyway, beyond that, I don’t much care or want money for this (though ruler has begged me to charge). I don’t feel that charging for something that violates a TOS anyway is much of an intelligent thing to do. Nor do I feel sythe/ruler/guy who made sbot, deserve compensation for having the intelligence to actually rip/and/or make cheats for a childs’ game; even if it is heavily obbed.

I’m not however quitting the rs2 cheating community, I’m simply becoming more inactive with it; I hope one day I may have the time/care/effort to start once again.

So with that, enjoy.

[edit] Might I get a sticky mates? [/edit][/quote] What is this used for? I have no idea what you guys are calling updaters! Updaters to me is when someone releases a new version of a program or patch and i download it

item.title: My Updater
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Here’s how I thought to figure this out.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.arrayindexoutofboundsexception: -1
First line. This tells you what the problem was. In this case, the code tried to access the -1 index of an array - which cannot exist - so you've probably got a null value or other "can't find it" error happening somewhere.
at org.apache.bcel.generic.constantpoolgen.setconstant(ConstantPoolGen.java:644)

The exception was thrown in BCEL’s ConstantPoolGen class, on line 644 of the source code. Odds are that this is not a BCEL bug (though they do happen occasionally), so it’s best to move on until you find code that you’re working with.

at com.bawt.update.ClientPatcher.hackmouse(ClientPatcher.java:391)

So this is the method that called the BCEL method that threw an exception. Looking at line 391 of ClientPatcher, I saw this:

cpg.setConstant(cpg.lookupUtf8("mouseClicked"), new ConstantUtf8("_mouseClicked"));

From the javadocs, I know that lookupUtf8 returns -1 when it can’t find the string

lookupUtf8

public int lookupUtf8(String n)

Look for ConstantUtf8 in ConstantPool.

Parameters:
    n - Utf8 string to look for 
Returns:
    index on success, -1 otherwise</blockquote>

So the call to setConstant at 391 is trying to place a new ConstantUtf8 entry at constant pool index -1 instead of replacing the constant pool entry for “mouseClicked.” Index -1 doesn’t exist, so it throws an exception.

In short, the problem seems to be that the string “mouseClicked” isn’t where the updater is looking for it.
This might mean that Jagex has moved some methods or caused another class to implement an interface with “Mouse” in the name, which apparently makes the updater register that class as the mouse class with no further checks.

Read full topic

item.title: My Updater
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

This is what i get with a completely unmodded version of psb’s updater:
Runescape Build #455
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.arrayindexoutofboundsexception: -1
at org.apache.bcel.generic.constantpoolgen.setconstant(ConstantPoolGen.java:644)
at com.bawt.update.ClientPatcher.hackmouse(ClientPatcher.java:391)
at com.bawt.update.ClientPatcher.(init)(ClientPatcher.java:125)
at com.bawt.update.ClientPatcher.main(ClientPatcher.java:16)

it used to work… it works on 454 for me… so yeh i think its a hook… but which one is the prob…
i’ve tried commenting out Hackmouse(); and then Hackkeyboard works, but then the other two don’t work… which hook do i need to comment out?.. something in hackmouse?

Read full topic
